audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker explaining he wants users to fill in a Word document as a PDF, so he will convert it. He mentions different conversion options, choosing to use the Acrobat tab. He continues speaking, mentioning the saving process, and then states "it's creating that". Finally, he announces "and there it is there".

A male speaker discusses another way to create something, mentioning opening Acrobat, using the file menu, and opening "all files" to open a conference document. He states the PDF is now ready to be turned into a form.

The clip begins with a male speaker stating there are "a number of ways I can do it." He then explains he is going to "use the prepare form option." He clarifies he doesn't want to scan a document and affirms he will "use this form, not change a different file."

The audio begins with a male speaker explaining the actions of Acrobat, noting that it "identified everywhere there was a line" and suggesting that it "probably needs to be a form field." He then describes renaming form fields, such as "ABN" for business number, and discusses adding a tooltip that says "name exactly as to appear on the program." The speaker states he doesn't want the company to be able to send the form without being named, marking it as a "required field," and adjusting other labels as "add one" and "add two," also making these fields required.

One male speaker provides instructions for filling out a form. He explains the function of a field for a postcode, then switches to discussing the state field and his desire for that field to be a drop-down, rather than a text box. He details changes he is going to make to the form options. He appears to be previewing the form as he explains the steps.

The audio features a single male speaker providing a tutorial. His tone is instructional and somewhat critical as he points out imperfections and seeks to fix them. He expresses slight dissatisfaction with the alignment of certain elements, stating, "I'm not really happy with the way that these aren't lined up." He plans to use a specific tool and edit features to address the issue. He moves the selected elements using arrow keys. He then emphasizes a bit of untidiness that he notices. He describes the process of copying, pasting, and renaming certain fields within the form, explaining why some elements defaulted to the left. He concludes by mentioning additional things that need to be added to the form.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker explaining how to add a checkbox to a document, mentioning agreeing to conditions on page one and emphasizing that the checkbox is required. The same male speaker then moves on to adding a second checkbox, reiterating that the user must check it. His tone throughout is instructional and informative, focused on clarifying the process.

A male speaker previews a form, mentioning that he could type his company name there and the name exactly as it appears on the program. He notes that sponsorship level is working, and suggests it could have been a dropdown for gold or platinum levels.

The audio clip begins with speech, where a male speaker is discussing the Australian Business Number and editing. He requests that the ABN number be a number with no separators at all and no decimal places.

The clip begins with a male speaker stating they will not discuss digital signatures in this tutorial, indicating an educational context. He then says his form is finished, speaking in a neutral tone. He goes on to describe saving options for the form.
